page.title: 09Stanton-under-Bardon Schools
page.content: We intervied Mrs Clegg who was our {caretaker}and came to Stanton -Under- Bardon Primary School herself.We asked her some questions about how the school used to be. The school was built in{1909}for children from{seven to fourteen years of age,to give the infant children in the{Church School,}which was built in{1866,}more space.It is recorded in the{school log book of 1902}as being overcrowded and badly ventilated, with over one-hundred and fifty children in the school. The{County School}opened on 11th October{1909,}with the Headmaster Mr.Boswell and two teachers and one-hundred and six pupils on the register.The playground was split up into two parts with a rail in the middle to separate boys and girls.
